description: Dive into "Munich's Hidden Beach Escapes" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Munich's Hidden Beach Escapes

sources.snippet: The self proclaimed crossroads of sports, culture and society – the Urban Beach Club is a great space to chill after a workout or checking out an exhibition. Sugar Mountain combines your not so typical Bavarian Beer garden with a cheeky Beach Volleyball court – bring a few friends down for a hit and a nourishing maß. Address: Helfenriederstraße 12
sources.shortName: The Top 10 Ultimate Batch Of Awesome Munich Beach Bars

reviews.text: Great public outdoor space with basketball courts, football field, beach volleyball fields, table tennis, climbing walls and skate park. There are also usually a few people around to play pick-up games.
Super cool spot for all ages. Sports, foodtrucks, Biergarten, music. My photos are from the early morning before it opened. Very easy to get to from the u3.

What a great event I attended here. With plant-based interiors from recycled materials, fewer parts for construction, and charismatic simplicity utilizing human-centric amenities, let me introduce you to the new family of electric MINIs including the electric MINI Cooper and the electric MINI Countryman. Held at Sugar Mountain during IAA Mobility in Munich, Germany, the fun, entertaining, and youthful atmosphere captured the essence and mindset of the MINI community in front of a global audience. Expect the MINI brand to go all-electric by 2030.

places.generalDescription: Feringasee, the largest swimming lake near Munich, is a popular spot for sunbathing and swimming. The southern shore features an official swimming area and a nudist-permitted peninsula beyond the kiosk. Visitors can enjoy grilling on the meadows along the southern shore and relax on the great sandy beach. While public transport access may be limited, it's an excellent place for a family picnic in summer with its green park and lake.

sources.snippet: Feringasee is the largest swimming lake near Munich and very popular with sunbathers. The southern shore is the official swimming area and the peninsula beyond the kiosk is a permitted nudist area. Grilling is permitted on nearly every meadow along the southern shore.Highlight: Check out the great sandy beach.
sources.shortName: The prettiest swimming lakes in and around Munich

sources.snippet: Maybe it’s not as popular as others, but we feel this is almost a mini-Bali. Not only you can enjoy all the same activities as the other lakes, but there’s also an actual sand-beach area. Volleyball court and the new fitness parkour are also in reach on the west side.
sources.shortName: Lakes in Munich: Best Lakes For Swimming Around Munich

sources.snippet: Feringasee, located north of Munich, can be reached via the S8 train with an exit at Unterföhring. It's just a ten minute walk from the where the train stops.
sources.shortName: Discover the Most Beautiful Lakes In and Around Munich

places.name: Feringasee

reviews.text: This is a great spot to spend the evening. You can enjoy a leisurely walk around the park, which might take about an hour at a slow pace. It's also perfect for grilling and hosting parties, like birthday celebrations or group meetings. There's even a nudist area. If you're driving, parking costs 3 euros until 6 pm, after which it becomes free. For ride-share cars like Ola and others, parking might cost 1.50 euros.
Really nice lake to swim, do barbecue in permitted sections and chill.

The place is not so conveniently accessible by public transport. It is a couple of kilometers from Unterföhring S-Bahn.

Apart from that it is an excellent place for a picnic with family and kids especially in summer. There is a green park with a lake in the middle. Bathing in the lake is possible. WC facilities are available. It has a pretty Biergarten. There are beach volleyball courts. Lot of people do barbecue here. Neatly maintained.

places.generalDescription: Riemer See, an artificial lake born from the 2005 Bundesgartenschau national garden show, is a stunning gem nestled in Munich's Riem district. Designed by French landscape architect Gilles Vexlard, this picturesque spot features a blend of urban and natural landscapes. The northern bank boasts a lively lakeside promenade, while the southern and western shores offer serene natural beauty. For sun-seekers, the eastern bank presents a charming shingle beach alongside inviting sunbathing areas.

sources.snippet: This lake offers you a real holiday feeling very near the capital city. The pebble beach on the eastern shore is great for sunbathing.Highlight: There's a beautiful park established in 2005 as part of the “Bundesgartenschau”, Germany's national horticultural show.
sources.shortName: The prettiest swimming lakes in and around Munich

places.name: Riemer See

reviews.text: Great outdoor picnic spot for residents of Munich and tourist for a peaceful timeout with kids to around. Not sure if you can do bbq if of your own but highly recommended place during Spring/Sumner times.

Good place for a swim
Though water was cold but you always find it less crowdy which is a plus
It also has large cycling track and loads of option to jump into water from a small hill
Highly recommend as it's not that high

Nice artificial lake, placed in a area that used to be part of Munich's old city airport. Clear water, a nice place to gather with family & friends. The lake is also adequate for practicing stand up paddling.

sources.snippet: Lußsee is right near Langwieder See and Birkensee on the northwestern side of Munich. The pebble beach is especially good for children.Birkensee is the smallest of the trio and perfect for relaxation.Highlight: You can have more lake; Langwieder See is only a few meters from the western shore of Lußsee.
sources.shortName: The prettiest swimming lakes in and around Munich

reviews.text: L like this Lake  very Clean. Summer almost everyday lm here . Sher gute entspannt und ruhige See

Lußsee is a charming lake known for its clear water and serene environment. Lußsee is a popular spot for swimming, sunbathing, and picnicking, especially during the summer months. The lake is well-maintained and provides amenities such as clean beaches, grassy areas, and a few walking paths.

Families and nature lovers appreciate the peaceful atmosphere, while the absence of motorboats ensures a tranquil experience. Nearby facilities, including parking and public transportation access, make it convenient for visitors. Overall, Lußsee offers a pleasant retreat from the bustling city, ideal for relaxation and outdoor activities.
It is must visit place for Tourists.

This stunningly beautiful lake, with a vast green area surrounding it, is a perfect spot for a family outing.  You'll find designated grilling areas, playgrounds for the kids, beach volleyball courts for some friendly competition, and even public restrooms for your convenience. There's also a handy kiosk where you can grab drinks and snacks.
Since grilling is allowed, feel free to bring your own equipment and enjoy a delicious cookout under the sun.  And to top it all off, the crystal-clear water is perfect for a refreshing dip.

sources.snippet: We love the day offerings of Munich Beach resort – only 40m from a swimming lake, this is the perfect spot to park up for the day. Treat yourself at the bars, book a court slot for beach volleyball or handball, book the VIP bar or a team building event – heck you can even book to get married here – Munich Beach Resort ticks all of your boxes. Address: Dachauer Str.
sources.shortName: The Top 10 Ultimate Batch Of Awesome Munich Beach Bars

reviews.text: They have a good selection of drinks. The atmosphere with the view on the regatta and the sand is amazing. We didnt try the food this time. Additionally the staff was super friendly and helpful.
Very relaxed place at the Ruderregatta - great for sunsets and after Beachvolleyball rehydration...
I am happy finding , good atmosphere that you can pass with child . Great Staff polite and friendly.
